name: outlook-add-in-sso-aspnet
title: Single Sign-on (SSO) sample Outlook add-in
shortDescription: The sample implements an Outlook add-in that uses Office's SSO feature to give the add-in access to Microsoft Graph data. Specifically, it enables the user to save all attachments to their OneDrive. It also shows how to add custom buttons to the Outlook ribbon.
longDescription: The sample implements an Outlook add-in that uses Office's SSO feature to give the add-in access to Microsoft Graph data. Specifically, it enables the user to save all attachments to their OneDrive. It also shows how to add custom buttons to the Outlook ribbon.

references.name: Authenticate a user with a single-sign-on token in an Outlook add-in
references.description: Single sign-on (SSO) provides a seamless way for your add-in to authenticate users (and optionally to obtain access tokens to call the Microsoft Graph API). Using this method, your add-in can obtain an access token scoped to your server back-end API.
